Package net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.sqlitehouse

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    SQLightable
    Designates a class as a data container which can be used in a database defined and managed by SQLiteHouse.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    QueryContextTest
    Exercises SQLiteHouse.QueryContext.
    RefractorMapTest
    Exercises RefractorMap
    SQLightable.Reflection<T extends SQLightable>
    A full reflection of a SQLightable object, which represents, and is used to marshal data for, an SQLite table.
    SQLightable.Reflection.ColumnMap<ST extends SQLightable>
    Provides a syntactic shorthand for working with maps of fields to column reflections.
    SQLightable.ReflectionMap
    Provides a precise method for retrieving an entry from a map of schematic classes to their SQLightable.Reflection instances.
    SQLightableBundlingTest
    Exercises the methods within SQLightable.Reflection which can marshal an instance to/from a Bundle.
    SQLightableReflectionColumnTest
    Exercises SQLightable.Reflection.Column.
    SQLightableReflectionTest
    Exercises SQLightable.Reflection.
    SQLightableStaticsTest
    Exercises the static utility methods of SQLightable.Reflection.
    SQLiteHouse<DSC extends SQLiteHouse>
    Uses custom annotations to automatically construct and manage SQLite databases with tables in which each row holds a serialization of a specified Java class.
    SQLiteHouse.ColumnIndexComparator
    Used by SQLiteHouse to sort the indices and/or names of columns within a table specification.
    SQLiteHouse.Factory
    Creates instances of a SQLiteHouse.
    SQLiteHouse.QueryContext<DBH extends SQLiteHouse>
    A short-lived, open data structure which provides context for various operations within the class.
    SQLiteHouseTest
    Exercises SQLiteHouse.
    SQLiteHouseTest.NoIntrospectionClass
    Used by SQLiteHouseTest.testFactoryFailureFromNoAnnotation() to verify that the SQLiteHouse.Factory will refuse to process a class that is not properly annotated.
